cRefPattern.p: This pattern references a specific line.
This pattern references an inscribed surface.
This pattern references a specific artefact, usually a tablet.

div.l: e2 ⸢e2⸣-e diri-ga#? [...] amaš gid2-da ma-⸢ra⸣-[...]
e2-e dug? mu-un-[...] kaš saga mu-un-de2#?
{kaš}AŠ2-AŠ2-imgaga3 ku7-ku7-dam gi-gar-re-eš mu-un-gal2
zu-a-zu hu-mu-un-ši-du-un kal-la-zu hu-mu-un-du-⸢un⸣
dumu gu5-li-zu nam-mu-ni-ib-tak4-tak4-a
ku4-ra-ma-ni-⸢ib⸣ dumu ki ag2-gu10
ku4-ra-ma-ni-ib dumu sa6-ga-gu10
u4 nam-zal-e ge6 nam-sa2-e
⸢iti6⸣ <e2>-ba nam-ba-ni-ib-ku4-ku4
u4 me-e-zal-la-gin7 ge6 me-e-sa2-a-gin7
ku4-ra ba-ni-hun-ge26 ki gar ma-ra-ab-du7
ša3-ba dur2!? gar-ke4 si ma-ra-ab-sa2-e
ku6-gu10 lu2 nu2-a-gu10 ba-ra-<<ra>>-zi-zi
lu2 tuš-a-gu10 du17 ba-ra-mu2-mu2
ku4!-ra-ma-ni-ib dumu ki ⸢ag2⸣-gu10
ku4-ra-ma-ni-ib dumu sa6-ga-⸢gu10⸣
i7 mun3-na-gin7 na-ba-al [...]
sahar-gar i7-gin7 zi-zi [...]
... built a house for you, ... built a storeroom for you
... built a house that is more than a house(!?), a long (sided?) sheepfold for you
In the house .... pot(s)? and poured(?) good quality beer (in them)
... put sweet beer up to the fence
So that your acquaintance(s) come towards you(!?), so that your friends come towards you(!?)
Do not abandon the child of your friend
Enter it for me, my beloved child
Enter it for me, my beautiful child
Don't spend the day (idle?), don't spend the night (idle?)
Do not bring moonlight into the house
As I have spent the day(?), as I have spent the night(?)
The one who enters is pacified there, the area(?) has been made appropriate for you
Sitting down in its midst(?) is set in order for you
My fish, so that my one(s) who sleep (there) do not wake up
So that my one(s) who dwell (there) do not quarrel
Enter it for me, my beloved child
Enter for me, my beautiful child
Do not dig (in it?) like a brackish waterway ...
Like river silt, do not learn how to rise (i.e., be excavated(?))
